com.device.login.rest.client

Interface ILoginServerUserAuthenticationClient

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LoginServerUserAuthenticationClientImpl

    public interface ILoginServerUserAuthenticationClient
    This interface gets the User Authenticated against the Login Server
    Author:
    raunak

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      UserSession authenticateUser(java.lang.String url, AppSession appSession, java.lang.String serviceSessionID, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Authenticates the User against the Login Server.

    • Method Detail

      • authenticateUser

        UserSession authenticateUser(java.lang.String url,
                           AppSession appSession,
                           java.lang.String serviceSessionID,
                           java.lang.String username,
                           java.lang.String password)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    RestClientException,
                                    InvalidResponseAuthenticatorException
        Authenticates the User against the Login Server. It requires the mutual authentication of the App and Service performed first.
        Parameters:
        url - String URL of the Login Server web service responsible to authenticate the User
        appSession - AppSession App Session created by the Service for the App on authentication
        serviceSessionID - String Kerberos generated Service Session ID for the App and Login Server
        username - String Username of the user to be authenticated
        password - String Password of the user to be authenticated
        Returns:
        UserSession object if the user is authenticated successfully else null
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In case there are some errors encountered while retrieving information
        RestClientException - If the status of the response is not 200. The server side error message and error response code can be accessed using getMessage and getErrorCode methods respectively
        InvalidResponseAuthenticatorException - If the Response Authenticator fails to validate
